definitions.definition: To raise (someone) to a more important, responsible, or remunerative job or rank.
definitions.example: He promoted his clerk to office manager.

definitions.definition: To advocate or urge on behalf of (something or someone); to attempt to popularize or sell by means of advertising or publicity.
definitions.example: They promoted the abolition of daylight saving time.

definitions.definition: (usually in passive form) To elevate to a higher league.
definitions.example: At the end of the season, three teams are promoted to the Premier League.

definitions.definition: To increase the activity of (a catalyst) by changing its surface structure.
To exchange (a pawn) for a queen or other piece when it reaches the eighth rank.
definitions.example: Having crossed the chessboard, his pawn was promoted to a queen.

definitions.definition: To move on to a subsequent stage of education.
definitions.example: At the end of Primary 6 students can promote directly to the secondary section of SIS.
